(B) Rob finished first
(C) Mel finished first
model_answer:
LECTURE: In an argument, a claim is a statement that a writer makes. An argument is an attempt to persuade an audience of the truth of a claim. In order to do this, a writer needs to present evidence that supports the claim.
For example, a writer might argue that the new policy at work is a good idea. The claim is that the new policy is a good idea. The evidence is that the new policy will save the company money.
There are different types of evidence that a writer can use to support a claim. The type of evidence a writer uses will depend on the type of claim the writer is making.
SOLUTION: The paragraphs describe a set of three golfers who finished in a specific order. To determine which golfer finished first, look at the sentences in each paragraph.
The first sentence in the first paragraph tells you that Rob finished below Mel. This means that Rob finished second. The second sentence in the first paragraph tells you that Mel finished below Eve. This means that Mel finished third. The third sentence in the first paragraph tells you that Eve finished first.

(B) The orange book is the second from the left
(C) The blue book is the second from the left
model_answer:
LECTURE: Objects are different from each other. When objects are arranged in order by their differences, the objects are put in a logical order.
To put objects in order by their differences, put them in order by their similarities.
Look at each pair of objects. For each pair, decide whether one object is different from the other.
If one object is different, the different object is the second object. The other object is the first object.
If the objects are the same, the objects are ordered.
SOLUTION: Put the books in order.
First, notice that the orange book is between the black book and the blue book.
So, the blue book is to the right of the orange book. The orange book is to the right of the black book.
Second, locate the orange book.
The orange book is between the black book and the blue book.
So, the blue book is the second from the left. The orange book is the second from the left.
The black book is the first from the left.
options: (A) The black book is the second from the left

model_answer:
LECTURE: In an argument, a common way to present a claim is to use a series of statements that are all based on the same set of facts. These statements are called a chain of reasoning.
A chain of reasoning can be made up of a series of claims that are based on each other. For example, claim 1 is based on claim 2, which is based on claim 1. These claims tell you that the second claim is just as reliable as the first claim.
When a chain of reasoning is used in an argument, the claims tell you how to interpret the facts. If each claim is based on the one before it, the claims show that the claims are a reliable way to interpret the facts.
SOLUTION: The paragraphs describe a set of three objects arranged in a fixed order. The statements in each paragraph are logically consistent with each other.
Eve finished below Amy.
Eve finished above Joe.
So, Eve finished first.

model_answer:
LECTURE: In an argument, a claim is a statement that a writer makes about a subject. An argument is an attempt to persuade an audience of a claim. To do this, a writer must offer evidence for the claim.
This paragraph makes a claim:
Forty-five percent of all Americans today are obese.
This paragraph makes a claim and offers evidence for the claim:
The United States is facing an obesity epidemic. In 2009, 45% of all Americans were obese, and 34% were overweight.
Some claims do not have counterarguments. Other claims do have counterarguments.
Counterarguments are reasons to question a claim. When you are writing, it is often helpful to consider counterarguments and to deal with them in your essay.
For example, a claim that sounds extreme might have a counterargument that takes the following form:
"This claim ignores the fact that... ."
Consider this claim:
The United States should implement a national policy to eliminate poverty.
This claim has a counterargument:
"This claim ignores the fact that poverty is a complex issue with many causes. A national policy may not be able to address all of these causes."

model_answer:
LECTURE: Logical order is the order in which objects are placed in order by their attributes.
If one object is longer than another object, and it is also heavier, then the longer, heavier object is in logical order.
If one object is shorter than another object, and it is also lighter, then the shorter, lighter object is in logical order.
If one object is smaller than another object, and it is also less expensive, then the smaller, less expensive object is in logical order.
If one object is larger than another object, and it is also more expensive, then the larger, more expensive object is in logical order.
SOLUTION: The objects are arranged in logical order by their colors.
The green book is to the left of the brown book.
The brown book is to the left of the orange book.

(B) The brown book is the second from the left

The following paragraphs each describe a set of three objects arranged in a fixed order. The statements are logically consistent within each paragraph. On a shelf, there are three books: a gray book, a purple book, and a red book. The purple book is to the left of the red book. The gray book is to the left of the purple book.
Options:
(A) The gray book is the rightmost
(B) The purple book is the rightmost
(C) The red book is the rightmost
model_answer:
LECTURE: Objects are made of matter. Matter is made up of tiny particles called atoms. Atoms can be linked together by chemical bonds. When two or more atoms link together, they form a molecule.
In the space between atoms in a molecule, there is a lot of space. So, molecules are not touching. But the space between atoms in a molecule is very small compared to the size of a molecule.
Because of this, it is useful to think of matter as a substance. A substance is a type of matter.
There are more than 100 different substances, or types of matter. Some substances are metal, water, and wood. Other substances are glass, soap, and plastic.
SOLUTION: The books are arranged in a straight line. This is called a line.
A line is a set of points that are ordered by their distance from each other. The distance between two points is called a distance.
Think about how you would describe the distance between two points. To do this, you need to determine how far each point is from a certain point. This certain point is called a reference point.
In this case, the gray book is a reference point. The other books are described by their distance from the gray book.
The gray book is the rightmost. The gray book is the reference point. The gray book is not to the left of any other book.
The purple book is to the left of the red book. The purple book is farther to the left than the red book.
options: (A) The gray book is the rightmost
(B) The purple book is the rightmost
(C) The red book is the rightmost

(B) Dan finished first
(C) Eve finished first
model_answer:
LECTURE: In an argument, a conclusion is a claim that is based on the evidence. When an argument or claim introduces irrelevant information, it is committing a red herring fallacy.
A red herring fallacy occurs when an argument or claim introduces information that is unrelated to the issue at hand. Introducing irrelevant information can cause the reader to become confused or misled, and may cause the writer to draw false conclusions.
The following argument commits a red herring fallacy by introducing irrelevant information:
Few people know that the original version of the song "Tonight" was recorded by the Steve Miller Band. But that version of the song was a complete failure.
This argument fails to address the issue of which version of the song is better. Instead, it introduces information about a different recording of the song.
SOLUTION: The paragraphs describe a set of three objects arranged in a fixed order. The order is important. For example, the order of the golfers in a tournament matters.
The order in which the statements are presented is important. Eve finished above Dan. Dan finished above Joe. So, Eve finished first, Dan finished second, and Joe finished third.

On a shelf, there are three books: a green book, a red book, and a blue book. The red book is the rightmost. The blue book is to the right of the green book.
Options:
(A) The green book is the second from the left
(B) The red book is the second from the left
(C) The blue book is the second from the left
model_answer:
LECTURE: Objects are arranged in a fixed order. The order of the objects is important.
The rightmost object is the red book.
The blue book is to the right of the green book.
SOLUTION: The second from the left is the green book.
The red book is the rightmost object.
The blue book is to the right of the green book.
options: (A) The green book is the second from the left
(B) The red book is the second from the left
(C) The blue book is the second from the left

(C) The purple book is the leftmost
model_answer:
LECTURE: Objects are arranged in a fixed order. The order is from left to right and from top to bottom.
A building is made up of many objects. These objects are arranged in a fixed order. The order tells you how the objects are placed.
Imagine being told that the sun is to the left of the Earth. At first, you might think that the sun is closer to the left side of the universe. But that is not what the description means.
The description means that, when you look at the sky, the sun is to the left of the Earth.
So, the order of the sun and the Earth is important. It tells you where the sun is relative to the Earth.
SOLUTION: The paragraphs below describe a set of three books arranged in a fixed order. The statements are logically consistent within each paragraph.
On a shelf, there are three books: an orange book, a white book, and a purple book. The orange book is to the left of the white book. The purple book is the rightmost.
The second paragraph says that the white book is the leftmost. But that is impossible. The orange book is the leftmost.
The third paragraph says that the purple book is the leftmost. This is incorrect. The orange book is the leftmost.
options: (A) The orange book is the leftmost

The leftmost and rightmost nodes on a branch are called the end nodes of the branch. The other nodes on the branch are called the inner nodes of the branch.
A tree with 3 nodes has 3 branches. The branch with all 3 nodes is called the middle branch. The branches with 2 nodes are called the inner branches.
SOLUTION: The branches of the tree have one, two, or three nodes. To determine which object is the leftmost, look at the first two objects.

model_answer:
LECTURE: Objects are made of matter. Matter is made up of tiny particles called atoms. Atoms can be linked together by chemical bonds. When two or more atoms link together, they form a molecule.
A substance is a type of matter. Substances that are made of the same type of matter are called elements. Substances that are made of different types of matter are called compounds.
Every substance is made of one or more elements. A substance may be composed of one element or multiple elements.
Some substances are composed of only one element.
A substance composed of only one element is a elementary substance.
Every elementary substance is a type of element.
Substances that are composed of multiple elements bonded together are called compounds.
A substance composed of multiple elements bonded together is a compound.
Not all substances are elementary substances or compounds. Some substances are made of matter that is not composed of elements.
A substance that is not made of matter is called a pure substance. Substances that are pure substances are made of only one type of matter.
The substances that are pure substances are elementary substances and compounds.
An substance that is not a pure substance is called a impure substance. Substances that are impure substances are made of multiple types of matter.
The substances that are impure substances are mixtures.
SOLUTION: The paragraphs tell you about three books. The books are a red book, a blue book, and an orange book.
The statements in each paragraph are logically consistent. That means the statements are true and make sense.
The red book is to the left of the orange book.
The orange book is the second from the left.
This set of statements tells you about the order of the books. The red book is to the left of the orange book. The orange book is the second book from the left.
